title: Limit number of servers hit per query for LLC
body:
Add code to limit the number of servers hit per query for LLC realtime tables,
similar to the one for large clusters. Refactor both the LLC routing table code
and the large cluster routing table code to share the routing table generation
code and only passing a different set of segments and replicas based on the
idiosyncracies of each table type (eg. for LLC, we don't want multiple
CONSUMING segments, for offline we only care about ONLINE, etc.).

Remove leftover debugging code that accumulated the number of replicas in a
fixed size array.

title: Cache totalDocs and totalRawDocs in SegmentMetadataImpl, instead of fetching from config within getter.
body:
In SegmentMetadataImpl, the getters for totalDocs/totalRawDocs fetch the
value from config (which is a hash-lookup). With large number of
segments, these fetches start showing up in the CPU profile. This change
is to fetch the values once in the constructor, and return it in the
getter.

title: Add a util to auto add inverted index
body:
Add a util to auto add inverted index based on the query response from the table
Add the util into the Pinot tools set
Add a new boolean field 'autoGeneratedInvertedIndex' into IndexingConfig to mark auto-generated invedted index

Mode:
1. NEW: Apply only to tables without inverted index
2. REMOVE: Remove all auto-generated inverted index
3. REFRESH: Refresh the auto-generated inverted index
4. APPEND: Append to the auto-generated inverted index

title: New Framework for Anomaly Detection Function
body:
The new framework breaks down the flow of an anomaly function into multiple reusable and pluggable components. In the new framework, an anomaly function consists the following models: 1. data model, 2. transformation functions, 3. prediction model, 4. detection model, and 5. merge model.

Overview of these models:
1. Data Model defines the time ranges of the training data for the current time series.
2. Transformation defines the transformation to be done before anomaly detection such as smoothing.
3. Prediction model takes as input the training data and output a trained prediction model. 
4. Detection model takes as input the trained prediction model and tests if there exist any anomalies on the current time series.
5. Merge model takes as input a merged anomaly and compute its weight and score.

Current implemented components for each model:
1. Data Model:
  a. SeasonalDataModel, which returns multiple non-consecutive time ranges of baselines of the observed time series.
  b. NoopDataModel, which returns an empty list of time ranges.
2. Transformation Function:
  a. MovingAverageSmoothingFunction, which smooth the given time series using moving average algorithm.
3. PredicationModel:
  a. SeasonalAveragePredictionModel, which returns the average values of multiple baselines.
  b. NoopPredictionModel, which does no-op during prediction.
4. DetectionModel:
  a. SimpleThresholdDetectionModel, which compare the observed and expected time series and returns the data point where the difference between observed and expected values exceeds user-specified threshold.
  b. NoopModel, which does no-op during testing.
5. MergeModel:
  a. AverageAnomalyMergeModel, which average the weight and score of the raw anomalies that are contained by the merged anomaly.
  b. SimplePercentageMergeModel, which uses the average percentage change between observed and expected time series as weight and average the scores of all raw anomalies of the merge anomaly.
  c. NoopMergeModel, which does no-op.

During anomaly detection, the input is stored in an AnomalyDetectionContext and important intermediate results and final detection results are appended to the context.

Moreover, AnomalyDetectionExecutor performs the algorithmic flow of anomaly detection, which applies transformation functions on all time series, trains prediction model, and detects anomalies. 

An enhanced version of WeekOverWeekRule is implemented, which provides smoothing and can use multiple weeks of baselines as the expected time series.

Test Has Done:
An unit test is included. The test applies moving average smoothing and use the average of 2 weeks baseline as the expected time series with the WeekOverWeekRule.

title: Fix configuration on hadoop mapreduce job
body:
I got following "Wrong FS" errors, when I run SegmentCreation job with pinot-hadoop.

It seems `new Configuration()` loads only empty `core-site.xml` file, and loads `fs.defaultFS` value as `file:///` in the MR job.
It will be fixed using `context.getProperty()` in the job.
Mapper would be better to use JobConf from their context.

Similar issue as #63.

	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem.checkPath(FileSystem.java:661)
	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.RawLocalFileSystem.pathToFile(RawLocalFileSystem.java:87)
	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.RawLocalFileSystem.deprecatedGetFileStatus(RawLocalFileSystem.java:619)

	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FilterFileSystem.getFileStatus(FilterFileSystem.java:422)

	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileUtil.copy(FileUtil.java:292)
	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.LocalFileSystem.copyToLocalFile(LocalFileSystem.java:88)
	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem.copyToLocalFile(FileSystem.java:1996)
	at com.linkedin.pinot.hadoop.job.mapper.HadoopSegmentCreationMapReduceJob$HadoopSegmentCreationMapper.createSegment(HadoopSegmentCreationMapReduceJob.java:154)
	at com.linkedin.pinot.hadoop.job.mapper.HadoopSegmentCreationMapReduceJob$HadoopSegmentCreationMapper.map(HadoopSegmentCreationMapReduceJob.java:134)
	at com.linkedin.pinot.hadoop.job.mapper.HadoopSegmentCreationMapReduceJob$HadoopSegmentCreationMapper.map(HadoopSegmentCreationMapReduceJob.java:44)

title: Log an error and update metric when zookeeper updates fail
body:
We have retries for helix updates, but if an update fails even after multiple retries
(as has been seen sometimes), we need to know about it.

Changed the retry policy to a linear fixed-delay policy with max 10 retries, attempting
an update every 1/2 second. (earlier we had exponential back-off with 5 max attempts).
This places a maximum time delay of 5 seconds to update zookeeper. Hopefully, zk is not
busy for more than 5 seconds.

Should an update fail after all these retries, we bump a metric, that we can alert on.
If this alert files, some manual repair of zookeeper may be needed, production experience
will tell better.

title: Fix the problem of retention manager not pick up the latest table config
body:
New logic for offline table:
- Keep the current deletion strategy when one of the followings happened:
  1. Failed to fetch the retention config.
  2. Push type is not valid (neither 'APPEND' nor 'REFRESH').
- Remove the deletion strategy when one of the followings happened.
  1. Push type is set to 'REFRESH'.
  2. No valid retention time is set.
- Update the deletion strategy when push type is set to 'APPEND' and valid retention time is set.

title: [PINOT-4325] Fix auto-correction logic for consecutive failing segments
body:
Modified createConsumingSegment() to consider whether the previous segment was completed or not, when it
tries to create a new consuming segment. If it was not completed, then the new segment is created with the
same start offset as the prev segment (or earliest available, if that is higher than the start offset
of prev segment).

If the prev segment is completed, then we attempt to create the new segment with a start offset equal to
the end offset (unless of course, that offset is not available in kafka, in which we case we pick the
earliest available offset).

In either case, a warning is printed if data is lost, and a table metric is incremented.

Added the setting of Long.MAX_VALUE as the end offset for auto-created segments. This part was missed before.

Added unit tests.

title: [thirdeye] add anomaly function clone and replay tools
body:
This pull request is to create a series tools that can be used for use case onboarding: clone and replay anomaly detection. Replay means that we can let it run in a given time range as it was in the past -- do anomaly detection, merge anomalies sequentially. 

major changes:

GenericDatabaseAccessTool.java consolidate basic database access DAOs
CloneAnomalyFunctionTool.java: clone function by ids and specify the new names
CleanupAndRegenerateAnoaliesTool.java (move this from test to main)

body:
Arrange package dependency:
1. Make DataTable an interface in pinot-common, move all implementations to pinot-core.
2. Rewrite DataTable implementation into DataTableImplV2, use custom ser/de only.
3. Rewrite DataTableBuilder to use custom ser/de only.
4. Add DataTableFactory to handle different version of DataTable (forward compatible).
5. Remove all java ser/de code.
6. Move request handler related classes into pinot-broker.

Old aggregation function clean up:
1. Remove the usage of old AvgPair and MinMaxRangePair and replace with new AvgPair and MinMaxRangePair.
2. IntermediateResult does not need to be Serializable because of the custom ser/de.
3. FinalResult should be Comparable to get the top N results.

repo.name: pinot
repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: Make v3 format as default segment format
body:
All servers will convert all segments to v3 format by default.
Tables can be explicitly configured to use v1 format. Segment
generation is still in v1 format. This commit is first step towards
making v3 format as default.

the latency of file operations on the data directory.

title: Enable large cluster routing for large clusters
body:
Enable the large cluster routing table strategy for large clusters
automatically (clusters with a size of at least 30 servers with at least
four replicas). Initialize the routing table builders properly.

title: Upgrade restlet version to 2.3.4
body:
Upgrade the version number of restlet to 2.3.4 from 2.2.1. Since we
use Jetty with restlet and 2.2.1 depends on Jetty 8 (which has been
EOL'ed for two years), upgrade to a version which uses a non-EOL'ed
Jetty.

title: Clean up old aggregation functions (Step 3)
body:
Move all broker side code to use new agrgegation functions.
1. Add AggregationGroupByTrimmingService class to perform trimming.
2. Refactor BrokerReduceService to use new aggregation functions and trimming service.
3. Change the intermediate data type in COUNT from MutableLong to Long.

title: Add raw indexing (no-dictionary) support for single-valued primitive data types.
body:
1. Added reader/writer for reading/writing raw (single) values for fixed width
primitive data types (int, long, float, double).

2. Enhanced segment generator to generate raw index for these data type.

3. Enhanced segment loader to load the raw index using appropriate
readers.

4. Modified data fetcher to support fetching data from raw index.

5. Enhanced dictionary based to raw index convertor to support these
data types.

6. Added unit tests for the reader/writer.

title: Enhance QueryRunner to report statistics for the current report window.
body:
The report window is configurable using argument -numIntervalsToReportAndClearStatistics.
With this change we can use the statistics to easily generate a time series QPS graph.
Two ways to get the accumulated QPS: 1. accumulate QPS from all report windows; 2. config -numIntervalsToReportAndClearStatistics to 0 (never)

repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: [PINOT-4244] Handle kafka exceptions during consumption
body:
Kafka may throw exceptions (such as java.net.SocketTimeoutException) without setting any of the
Kafka error codes. We treat them as temporary errors for now.

Changed temporary error handling to create a new kafka consumer, to improve our chances against
a kafka failure affecting all replicas of a partition at the same time

title: [PINOT-3788] Stop consuming when realtime segment is full
body:
This condition should happen rarely, if any. If it does happen, we will stop
consuming, indicate to the controller that we have stopped consuming, and go into
ERROR state.

title: [PINOT-4172] Fix LLC segment cleanup when conumer type is changed
body:
When consumer type is changed from "highLevel,simple" to "highLevel" for any reason
we need to delete the segments on disk as well. Going through the deletion manager
deletes from idealstate, and also from propertystore and disk

Tested by contriving a case in LLCRealtimeClusterIntegrationTests

title: [PINOT-4167] Auto-update LLC Kafka partition assignment if any parameters change
body:
Automatically update the kafka assignment if the capacity or the number of kafka partitions
or the number of replicas per partition changes for the realtime table. The changes will take
effect after the next succcessful run of ValidationManager

title: Enhance SelectionOperatorUtils/Service to allow rows with type compatible data schema to merge.
body:
1. Solve the problem of segments with not identical but type compatible data schema cannot merge.
2. All numbers are type compatible, but not type compatible with other types.
3. For selection order-by with limit 0, use SelectionOnly operator to improve performance.
4. Optimize the logic of selection only (data schema should be the same as selection columns).
5. Fix the bug of throwing exception when order by the same column multiple times.
6. Fix the behavior of swallow merge exceptions in server side.

repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: Controller delete segment will directly drop segments from ideal state
body:
Controller will directly delete the segments from helix ideal state instead
of marking those offline first and then removing those from idealstate. Helix
manages the part of marking those offline first and then dropping those. Added APIs
for bulk modification of segments for efficiency.

Testing: manual

repo.name: pinot
repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

repo.name: pinot
repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: No-dictionary indexing support for single-valued string columns.
body:
1. Added new Reader/Writer for variable byte length (string) data
   with customizable compression.

2. Added capability to generate/load segments with columns without dictionary:
   - Forward index contains actual values of data, instead of dictionary ids.
   - For high cardinality usecases, with large variance in string lengths,
     this provides > 2X storage space saving (mostly from eliminating paddingy).

3. Added convertor from dictionary encoded to no-dictionary segment.

4. Added unit tests for index creator, as well as var-byte reader/writers.

title: Refactor: Modify BlockValSet interface to support filtered as well as unfiltered blocks.
body:
Refactor: Modify BlockValSet interface to support filtered as well as unfiltered
blocks.
1. Added api's to get values for a specific set of docIds. This is
required to support fetching values from DataSource block, which does
not have docIds of its own (as opposed to Projection block).
2. Pushed down responsibility to get dictionary id's for docId's, from
DataBlockCache to DataFetcher. This is in preparation for no-dictionary
support.
